titleStmt.title: A letter to A, B, C, D, E, F, &c. concerning their argument about a standing army examining their notions of the supposed Gothick or other ballance, by the constitution and interest of the English monarchy.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for D. Brown ..., and R. Smith ..., and sold by E. VVhitlock ...,

notesStmt.note: A reply to John Trenchard's An argument shewing that a standing army is inconsistent with a free government.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
